channel.title: Computer started up different today...?
channel.description:
Normally my computer will go straight to the account decision, but today the screen went black and a box that said something about WINDOWS/command.com repeatedly popped up. It probably opened about 10+. I shut down my computer, and then I got to the account decision. After I logged on, the same thing happened but it said a frame.dll or a file near that could not be found. I restarted one more time, and this time I logged in successfully. The box however kept opening up until my msn opened aswell.
I am not sure what went wrong. The only thing I can imagine is from yesterday. The SpyBot Search & Destroy program which wanted to run the next time the computer started so it could delete some PUPs. I am running a virus scan just incase. Does anyone have any ideas what went/is wrong?

item.title: Computer started up different today...?
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:39, topic:296376”][quote author=933pm link=topic=392400.msg2933691#msg2933691 date=1251421805]
You like graphics, music, and browsing the internets (and nothing else)?
Go Mac.

You like programming/servers?
Go Linux.

You like doing a wide variety of things and playing games?
Go Windows.

Or be like me and have all three on different computers… My mac is a little old however so I don’t use it all too much.
[/quote]

3 different computers? Because you can’t have them all (or at least two) on the same computer? Linux will run beside anything.[/quote]

You can, but why mix anything with a Mac?

Linux+Windows is fine but I’d rather have them separately if possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer started up different today...?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“xeez`, post:34, topic:296376”]I have been operating under a linux environment since about 5 years ago. The first summer job I got consisted of programming C applications under UNIX systems. I had little experience with C, and far less with the UNIX libraries. The little I knowledge I had with C consisted of using windows API. So, I downloaded Fedora and started programming under it.

After time passed by, I completely removed Windows from my system. I’ve been with linux since then :). I have tried a variety of distros, of course, but never switched from linux.

My opinion can be considered biased since I’m looking at it from a programmer’s point of view, but honestly, I think linux is best.[/quote]
I do not believe you.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer started up different today...?
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:28, topic:296376”][quote author=the fu superior link=topic=392400.msg2922557#msg2922557 date=1250836459]

the fu superior you’re pretty fucking ignorant…

All you’ve done so far is make simple minded insults.
Because you know that Windows kills Linux in every way imaginable.
Mac OS X, could l0l at Linux.

The same could be said for you. All you’ve said is bullshit about how YOU think Windows is better than Linux.

Mmkay Frodo… don’t defend Uriko. He’s perfectly capable of flaming me on his own without your help.
[/quote]

Obviously you’re changing the subject because you cannot come up with a valid reason as to why you think Windows is better than Linux. Just because you suck at everything, including operating systems doesn’t mean the OS sucks.[/quote]
Sorry, what are your arguments again?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer started up different today...?
item.dc:creator: @xeez xeez`
item.description:
@xeez wrote:

I have been operating under a linux environment since about 5 years ago. The first summer job I got consisted of programming C applications under UNIX systems. I had little experience with C, and far less with the UNIX libraries. The little I knowledge I had with C consisted of using windows API. So, I downloaded Fedora and started programming under it.

After time passed by, I completely removed Windows from my system. I’ve been with linux since then :). I have tried a variety of distros, of course, but never switched from linux.

My opinion can be considered biased since I’m looking at it from a programmer’s point of view, but honestly, I think linux is best.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer started up different today...?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I used to like linux but I couldnt play any of my games getting alot of my windows apps to work. Use autocad/solidworks. I mean dont get my wrong osx is great for surfting the web/checking your email. But for most people knew to computers it can be a bit overwhelming, and now with the release of windows 7 which I like very much it may be a bit hard to keep up. I dont see why everyone complains about viruses. Honestly if you cant use a windows computer with decent anti-vrius software and not get a virus you shouldnt be using a computer at all. I think ive only every had 3 viruses and that was on old operating systems, even then I could remove them and everything would be just fine.

Read full topic
